biases.name: Repetition Bias
biases.description: Frequently repeating similar questions or concepts, leading to overemphasis on certain topics while neglecting others.

biases.name: Complexity Bias
biases.description: Generating questions that are either too easy or too difficult, without a balanced mix of difficulty levels.

biases.name: Ambiguity Bias
biases.description: Using vague or unclear wording that makes it difficult for students to determine the correct answer.

biases.name: Terminology Bias
biases.description: Overusing or underusing technical terms, making the questions too jargon-heavy or too simplified.

biases.name: Stereotypical Scenarios
biases.description: Framing questions with biased or unrealistic assumptions, limiting diverse perspectives.

biases.name: Neglecting Conceptual Understanding
biases.description: Focusing more on factual recall rather than testing deep understanding and application of concepts.

biases.name: Cultural Bias
biases.description: Using region-specific examples or idioms that may not be universally understood.

biases.name: Pattern Bias
biases.description: Creating answer choices that follow a predictable pattern, making it easier for test-takers to guess the answers without understanding the content.

biases.name: Redundancy Bias
biases.description: Repeating similar concepts in different ways, leading to unnecessary repetition and reduced coverage of diverse topics.

biases.name: Imbalance Bias
biases.description: Favoring certain topics while ignoring others, leading to an incomplete assessment of subject knowledge.

biases.name: Gender Bias
biases.description: Using gendered language or examples that reinforce stereotypes.

biases.name: Formulaic Bias
biases.description: Strictly adhering to a specific structure without variation, making it easy to predict answers.

biases.name: Distractor Imbalance
biases.description: Providing answer choices where the incorrect options are either too obvious or completely unrealistic.

biases.name: Misleading Questions
biases.description: Framing questions in a way that can mislead students into choosing incorrect answers due to tricky wording.

biases.name: Overfitting to Training Data
biases.description: Generating questions that closely resemble training data instead of creating novel and diverse questions.
